intro: Acourtia nelsonii, commonly known as Nelson's acourtia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small yellow flowers. Acourtia nelsonii is often found in coastal and inland deserts, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
